page.title: 13Public Transport.
page.content: {Chapeltown station}is served by the {Hallam Link Line.}The children found that it had limited facilities - it is like a{'bus stop'.}No-one is employed there. The trains connect to{Barnsley, {Sheffield, Wakefield and Leeds,} calling at local stations. Over 90% of those surveyed said they rarely used the station, although this fell to 70% of those who lived closer to the station. There is a good cheap bus service to all major towns in the area. Transport policy means a journey costs{15p for {adults and 2p for children,}compared to 75p for a comparative journey in other towns. There is a bus pass system for O.A.Ps. Nevertheless{50% of the survey sample{rarely used a {bus.}Residents in High Green feel a more direct service to Sheffield is needed, this is to be improved.
